N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1501.4 - Operating temperatures

State Regulations
(a) Fire
detecting devices of the fixed temperature type shall operate when the
temperature rises to 165 degrees Fahrenheit, when installed in areas where the
maximum temperature at the ceiling is 100 degrees Fahrenheit. Where higher
temperatures normally exist at the ceiling, such as in furnaces or boiler
rooms, kitchens, laundries, etc., fire detecting devices may operate at higher
temperatures providing such higher operating temperatures are commensurate with
the ceiling temperatures. (b) Fire
detecting devices of the rate-of-rise type shall operate whenever the rate of
the rise in temperature exceeds 20 degrees per minute. Notes
